text: Ig heavy chain class switching is directed by cytokines inducing transcription from unrearranged CH genes .
Subsequently , such primed cells can undergo switch recombination to express the selected new isotype .

In the case of IgE class switching , <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activates the IgE germline promoter by inducing the interaction of the transcription factor <extra_id_0> STAT6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-4STAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) with a responsive DNA element in the proximal region of the promoter .

text: This study describes the characterization of two additional cis - acting elements that interact with members of the NF kappa B / rel transcription factor family in an <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - independent fashion .

Electrophoretic mobility shift assays show that the nucleoprotein complex formed on the upstream site ( <extra_id_0> NF kappa B1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) contains the classical <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> heterodimer .

text: The complex on the proximal site ( <extra_id_0> NF kappa B2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) appears to be composed of <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> relB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

IgE germline promoter reporter gene constructs carrying point mutations in the <extra_id_0> NF kappa B2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> site were largely unresponsive to <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> stimulation in transient transfection experiments , while plasmids with similar mutations in the <extra_id_0> NF kappa B1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> site responded to cytokine stimulation better than the wild-type promoter .

The <extra_id_0> NF kappa B2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> effect was dependent on the presence of the <extra_id_0> STAT6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binding site , demonstrating that the <extra_id_0> NF kappa B2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> motif is necessary but not sufficient for mediating cytokine up-regulation .
